Functions Module¶

class finite_topology.functions.Function(source: Topology, target: Topology, mapping: dict)¶

Bases: object

Represents a function between two topological spaces. It can be continuous, open, etc.

Attributes: - source (Topology): The topological space from which the function originates. - target (Topology): The topological space to which the function maps. - mapping (dict): A dictionary mapping elements from the source space to the target space.

get_image(subset: set) → set¶

Obtains the image of a given set in the source space.

get_preimage(subset: set) → set¶

Obtains the preimage (inverse image) of a given set in the target space.

is_bijective() → bool¶

Checks if the function is bijective.

is_continuous() → bool¶

Checks if the function is continuous.

is_homeomorphism() → bool¶

Checks if the function is a homeomorphism.

is_injective() → bool¶

Checks if the function is injective (one-to-one).

is_open_mapping() → bool¶

Checks if the function is an open mapping.

is_surjective() → bool¶

Checks if the function is surjective (onto).
